answerText: hemoglobin[10] This breakdown product of hemoglobin is usually conjugated to glucuronate for excretion in bile. A condition in which there is an excess of this compound can first be seen by looking under the tongue.
heading: Penn Bowl |2014 | Packet 2 | 8 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This protein's subunits are produced in an imbalanced fashion in beta-thalassemia, and in acidic environments its binding curve moves in the Bohr effect. For 10 points each: [10] Name this protein consisting of two alpha and two beta subunits. It's prosthetic groups are porphyrins coordinated to iron, which are responsible for reversibly binding oxygen.
